author: Will Glasgow
title: Peter Bond's Linc Energy grief could be your private island delight
text:
Peter Bond in a hard hat. Did you know he is a massive fan of motivational speaker Tony Robbins? Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Will Glasgow Horrible news this about one of our favourite entrepreneurs, Peter Bond , he of the licence to drill .
Those sticklers on the Singapore stock exchange have placed Bond's SGX-listed Linc Energy on a watch list after it triggered "Rule 1312" .
Linc's offence? Posting a pre-tax loss over its three most recent consecutive years â€“ just in case any investors hadn't noticed.
Yes, first the Singaporese banned chewing gum , then they ordered the caning of those two Germans for spray painting a train , and now this.
Rod Clement To think David Gonski wanted the Australian Stock Exchange to merge bourses with those killjoys. Putting economies of scale to one side, what was he thinking?
The watch list notification is the latest bit of bad news for Bond, as his business is pummeled by international energy markets.
Now is not a good time to specialise in technology that extracts petroleum from coal. Just have a look at Linc's share price, down more than 90 per cent since it relocated from Australia to Singapore in late 2013.
In the good old days, Bond's wealth was valued at $450 million on the BRW Rich List in 2013 . This year, he didn't place.
 What all this means for Dunk Island, a patch of the Great Barrier Reef owned by the energy entrepreneur, isn't clear. Bond bought it for $8 million after Cyclone Yasi tore it apart in 2011.
Let's hope it isn't soon in the island bargain bin once again.
